meanings.definition: To have a paralyzing or petrifying effect on someone.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie was so gorgonizing that I couldn't move from my seat.
meanings.sent2: The snake's gaze was gorgonizing, freezing its prey in fear.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house tour guide joked that the ghost stories were gorgonizing the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gorgonized the once cheerful atmosphere, casting a shadow over the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The sudden silence in the room was gorgonizing, making everyone uneasy.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel intense fear or dread.
meanings.sent1: The thought of failing the exam was gorgonizing her mind.
meanings.sent2: The eerie sound in the forest was gorgonizing, sending shivers down his spine.
meanings.sent3: The ghost costume was so realistic that it was gorgonizing the little children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The impending storm clouds gorgonized the beachgoers, making them rush to pack up.
meanings.sent5: The deep growl of the bear was gorgonizing, causing the hikers to freeze in fear.
